meanings.definition: The beginning or start of something.
meanings.sent1: The inception of the race marked the official start.
meanings.sent2: The team celebrated the inception of their project with a small party.
meanings.sent3: At the inception of the play, the actors forgot their lines and improvised hilariously.
meanings.sent4: Her graduation marked the inception of a new chapter in her life.
meanings.sent5: The inception of the novel was filled with excitement and anticipation.

meanings.definition: The establishment or foundation of something.
meanings.sent1: The inception of the company was a humble office space.
meanings.sent2: The inception of the charity brought hope to many in need.
meanings.sent3: The inception of the club involved a quirky initiation ritual.
meanings.sent4: The inception of the treaty laid the groundwork for future peace talks.
meanings.sent5: The inception of the tradition was met with enthusiasm by all.

meanings.definition: The initiation or commencement of something.
meanings.sent1: The inception of the journey began with a single step.
meanings.sent2: The inception of the event was met with great anticipation.
meanings.sent3: The inception of the game had everyone laughing at the rules mix-up.
meanings.sent4: The inception of the concert signaled the start of a memorable night.
meanings.sent5: The inception of the plan brought excitement and nervousness in equal measure.
